author: travelandtourworld.com
title: USINPAC Partners with NewsX to Host Two Roundtable Conferences in San Francisco on 25th SeptemberTravelandtourworld.com
text:
USINPAC Partners with NewsX to Host Two Roundtable Conferences in San Francisco on 25th September
USINPAC has partnered with NewsX, one of the top 24-hour English news media channel, to host two Television Round Table Conferences in San Francisco—’Make in India: Opportunities & Challenges’ & ‘Is India ready to go digital?’ on the 25th of September 2015.
The programming line-up on NewsX will telecast the roundtable discussions in India on the 26th of September, along with prime time debates and live reports of the events unfolding in the US including live coverage from San Jose where the Indian Prime Minister will address the Indian-American community.
PM Modi’s two-day visit to the Silicon Valley, starting September 26, has a number of headline-grabbing moments. His US visit got another boost with the Union Cabinet clearing the $2.5 billion Apache attack helicopter deal ahead of the September 23-29 visit to Ireland and the US.
The highlights of the ‘Make in India’ roundtable discussions are creating tomorrow’s smart cities in India and related infrastructure, boosting and participating in India’s business environment to benefit Indian and American businesses, developing best practices around innovation and entrepreneurship, enhance Indo-US trade relation, and deepen Indian industries’ integration into global supply chains.
The second round table conference ‘Is India ready to go digital?’ will address the issues on creating a digital infrastructure in India, delivering services digitally and enhancing overall digital literacy in the country.
Mr. Sanjay Puri, Chairman of USINPAC said, “The Television Roundtable discussions make a great platform for brainstorming prospects and roadblocks of the two major initiatives by the Modi government that have the power to transform India by connecting masses and leading them towards building a knowledge economy”.
“These panels will be Must-See-TV for anyone interested in US-India business and will provide helpful insight for understanding Prime Minister Modi’s trip to Silicon Valley. The experts are well known and well versed in these two topics that will play a key role in Modi’s agenda over the coming days.” – Manish Antani, attorney at the California law firm Eisner Jaffe.
“These panels with these great panelists here will be forward looking….. and try to identify direction leading to a better future empowering our nation”
The main panelist of the Roundtable discussions include; Mr. Sanjay Puri, Chairman of US India Political Action Committee (USINPAC), Mr. Gordon Feller, Director: Office of the Exec Vice Pres. at Cisco Systems, Navneet chugh, Founder & Managing Partner at The Chugh Firm, Dr. Rajesh Shrotriya, Chairman & CEO at Spectrum Pharmaceuticals, Mohan Ananda, Chairman & CEO at SecondOpinionExpert, Inc and Sanjay Srivastava, Chief Digital Officer at Genpact
